ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 7 Space Environment Monitor Data, X-ray, Magnetic Field, Electrons and Corrected Integral Protons, at 5 min Time Resolution
ResourceHeader.Description: This GOES 7 SEM data set contains various parameters at 5 min time resolution. Within the data files is the Xray flux for two wavelength ranges, the magnetic field vectors, the >2 MeV corrected electron fluxes, and the uncorrected proton fluxes for several energy ranges.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories, Harold Leinbach, Herbert H. Sauer, Terry G. Onsager, Howard J. Singer, Howard Garcia

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 7 SEM data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 7 SEM data in ASCII format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, A0558606.FIT indicates the type of particle data (A) for spacecraft 5 (05) at 5 min time resolution (5) from June 1986 (8606).

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NOAA Environmental Research Laboratories, Harold Leinbach, Herbert H. Sauer, Terry G. Onsager, Howard J. Singer, Howard Garcia

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2-digit year, 2-digit month, 2-digit day, 2-digit hour, 2-digit minute, and 3-digit day of year.

Parameter.Name: Date and Time
Parameter.Description: Time is given in 3 columns. Time format in data files is YYMMDD HHMM DOY (2-digit year, 2-digit month, 2-digit day, 2-digit hour, 2-digit minute, and 3-digit day of year.

Parameter.Name: Solar X-ray Monitor
Parameter.Description: Solar X-ray monitor flux in Two different wavelength ranges in units of W/m^2

Structure.Description: Solar X-ray monitor fluxes from two wavelength ranges: 1 to 8 Å and 0.5 to 4 Å

Parameter.Name: GOES 7 Magnetic Field Monitor Magnetic Field Vectors at 5 min Time Resolution Data in Spacecraft Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Magnetic field vector for GOES 7 in spacecraft coordinates in units of 0.1 nT. The values must be divided by a factor of 10 to nT. HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 7.

Structure.Description: HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the orbital plane of the spacecraft. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and points eastward for GOES 7.

Parameter.Name: 2 MeV electrons
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected ≥2 MeV electrons number fluxes in units of counts/(cm^2 s sr). These values are especially unreliable during ion storms.

Parameter.Name: Corrected Protons
Parameter.Description: Corrected Proton number fluxes in units of counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV) for 7 different energy channels.

Structure.Description: Each Name provides the energy range for each channel.

Element.Name: >1 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>5 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>10 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>30 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>50 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>60 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
>100 MeV protons in counts/(cm^2 s sr MeV), corrected
